intro: Acmella alba var. ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorean buttonweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in wet, tropical environments and is often found in marshy areas or along riverbanks. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered with fine pubescence. It is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its compact growth habit and attractive blooms.
